alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued November 28 at 5:20PM PST until November 30 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Wilbur, Harrington, Cheney, Davenport, Fairfield, Odessa, Rockford, Coulee City, Creston, Airway Heights, and Ritzville. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 8 AM PST Wednesday. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 11 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Motorists should be prepared for thick fog on Interstate 90 from Spokane to Sprague to Ritzville. Areas of near zero visibility will also occur along Highway 195 from Spokane to Colfax to Uniontown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly.
